snippet: Mike Rizzo was upset that Phillies pitcher Cole Hamels hit the rookie Bryce Harper with a pitch and then said he deliberately plunked him.
abstract: MLB Roundup; Judge Reggie Walton lectures prosecutors and defense lawyers in perjury case against Roger Clemens that the proceedings are plodding along so slowly that jurors are losing interest; urges them to stop asking unnecessary questions and showing needless photographs; other baseball news and results noted.
lead_paragraph: Mike Rizzo was upset that Phillies pitcher Cole Hamels hit the rookie Bryce Harper with a pitch and then said he deliberately plunked him.

headline.seo: Nationals’ G.M. Disciplined for Hamels Remarks
headline.main: Nationals’ General Manager Disciplined for Hamels Remarks
headline.print_headline: Slow Pace of Clemens Trial Is Boring Jurors, Judge Says
